The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a distinct costa that extends beyond the middle of the leaf. It has a widespread distribution across Asia, including regions such as China, Japan, and the Korean Peninsula. This moss is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of alpine and arctic ecosystems.
